benchmark_details.name: CLOTHO (Measuring Task-Specific Pre-Generation Test Adequacy for LLM Inputs)
benchmark_details.overview: CLOTHO is a task-specific, pre-generation adequacy measure that estimates input difficulty directly from hidden LLM states and ranks inputs by their likelihood of failure to improve task-specific LLM testing.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of CLOTHO is to improve task-specific LLM testing by prioritizing which inputs to run and label first, ideally exposing failures earlier and with less effort.

data.source: Aggregated datasets across multiple tasks with specific prompts and input requirements.
data.annotation: Labelling is performed by human annotators based on model outcomes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the likelihood of passing inputs in relation to the reference distribution derived from hidden states.
methodology.interpretation: A higher ROC-AUC score indicates better performance in failure prediction and test input prioritization.
methodology.baseline_results: Tests were compared against existing pre-generation and post-generation metrics.
methodology.validation: Validation of CLOTHO was performed across eight benchmark tasks.
